availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James H. Cheek (Cumberland County, Kentucky, physician.)

body.p: Cumberland County, Kentucky, physician. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Agnes Bledsoe Cheek. Father of Elizabeth Cheek, Joel Cheek, Hiram M. Cheek, John Cheek, and Thomas Cheek. Guardian of Annea O. Howard. Physician in Cumberland County in 1850. Household owned fourteen enslaved persons in Cumberland County in 1850. Physician in Cumberland County in 1860. Employed Tompkins Cheek in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Cumberland County, Burkesville, p. 534A-B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Cumberland County, Burkesville, p. 371.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Cumberland County, District No. 2, p. 72.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Cumberland County, District No. 2, p. 10A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Cumberland County, Burkesville, p. 2A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994032, Cumberland County Births, p. 3.
"Dr. James Hill Cheek (1809-1885)," Find A Grave, Memorial #203722250, accessed March 16, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/203722250.
